data.text:
One of the hallmarks of run & gun filmmakers is their ability to improvise and create engaging visuals for their audience, even without a script.

In this article, I’ll delve into the dynamic realm of improvisational filmmaking, offering insights and tips for creating powerful storytelling in an unknown environment. So, if you’re prepared to think on your feet and adapt to any situation, let’s dive right in!

Capture Different Angles

Begin by capturing various angles to establish the context of the story. I typically start with aerial shots using a drone to highlight the location. Instead of immediately introducing the protagonist or subject, I create an environment that immerses the viewer in the scene. As you film, consider how you’ll edit these clips together to provide a sense of continuity to the story.
